TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/ Click the “Continue” button to start the experiment.
notext
Take a butter paper.
Place it on the electronic balance and tare it into 0.0000 g.
Take the brass powder using spatula.
Weigh accurately about 1.0000 g of Brass powder.
Transfer brass into 250 mL beaker.
Take one measuring jar and to it take 15 mL of 10 N HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Take one measuring jar and to it take 15 mL of 10 N HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Take one measuring jar and to it take 15 mL of 10 N HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Add 15 mL of 10 N HNO[sub]3[/sub] to the beaker containing brass using measuring jar. A precipitate (stannic acid) is formed, and that will settle down to the bottom of the beaker.
notext
Take a dropper from the lab bench.
Take a few drops of 10 N HNO[sub]3[/sub] from the bottle.
Two drops of 10 N HNO[sub]3[/sub] are added to the beaker to ensure complete percipitation of stannic acid.
Place the beaker on the burner.
Place the beaker on the burner.
Heat until most of the solution in the beaker is evaporated.
Take the beaker from the burner.
Dilute with 50 mL water and stir using glass rod.
Place it on the burner and heat for 25 mins.
Place it on the burner and heat for 25 mins.
Place it on the burner and heat for 25 mins.
Add some paper pulp (1 or 2) and stir it using glass rod.
Take the beaker from the burner and allow it to cool for some time.
Take the beaker from the burner and allow it to cool for some time.
Take a funnel with Whatman filter paper.
Keep a beaker under the funnel.
Filter through Whatman filter paper and wash the precipitate with dil HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Filter through Whatman filter paper and wash the precipitate with dil HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Filter through Whatman filter paper and wash the precipitate with dil HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Filter through Whatman filter paper and wash the precipitate with dil HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Filter through Whatman filter paper and wash the precipitate with dil HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Filter through Whatman filter paper and wash the precipitate with dil HNO[sub]3[/sub].
Take a silica crucible from the desiccator using tongs.
Take the Weight of empty crucible.
Take the crucible out of the electronic balance.
Place the crucible on the tile and open the lid.
Transfer the precipitate with filter paper into weighed silica crucible.
Transfer the precipitate with filter paper into weighed silica crucible.
Ignite the precipitate at 900-1000°C until a constant weight of SnO is obtained. First use a Bunsen burner. After the filter paper is burned, ignite it in the electric burner.
Ignite the precipitate at 900-1000°C until a constant weight of SnO is obtained. First use a Bunsen burner. After the filter paper is burned, ignite it in the electric burner.
Ignite the precipitate at 900-1000°C until a constant weight of SnO is obtained. First use a Bunsen burner. After the filter paper is burned, ignite it in the electric burner.
Ignite the precipitate at 900-1000°C until a constant weight of SnO is obtained. First use a Bunsen burner. After the filter paper is burned, ignite it in the electric burner.
Using tongs, remove the crucible from the electric burner, cool it and keep it in desiccator (5 min. ) using tongs.
notext
Take the weight of the crucible + substance .Weight of crucible + Tin dioxide= 20.2578g.
Tin is precipitated as Tin dioxide.
Tin is precipitated as Tin dioxide.
notext
Estimation of Lead
Take the above filtrate in the beaker.
Place the beaker containing filtrate on the Bunsen burner.
Concentrate the filtrate to 50 mL.
Take it out and allow it to cool.
Take it out and allow it to cool.
Take it out and allow it to cool.
Add conc. H[sub]2[/sub]SO[sub]4[/sub] using measuring jar.
Add conc. H[sub]2[/sub]SO[sub]4[/sub] using measuring jar.
Add conc. H[sub]2[/sub]SO[sub]4[/sub] using measuring jar.
Place the beaker on the burner.
Place the beaker on the burner.
Evaporate the solution until fumes are evolved.
Take the beaker from the burner and cool it for some time. Then dilute it to 100ml using distilled water.
Take out the beaker from the burner and Cool it and dilute to 100 mL using distilled water.
Heat the solution on a burner until a percipitate is formed.
Heat the solution on a burner until a percipitate is formed.
Heat the solution on a burner until a percipitate is formed.
Take the beaker from the burner and allow it to cool.
Take the beaker from the burner and allow it to cool.
Take the sintered crucible from the desiccator.
It is weighed in an electronic balance.
notext
notext
Filter through a weighed sintered crucible.
Filter through a weighed sintered crucible.
Filter through a weighed sintered crucible.
Filter through a weighed sintered crucible.
The solution is washed with 1% H[sub]2[/sub]SO[sub]4[/sub].
The solution is washed with 1% H[sub]2[/sub]SO[sub]4[/sub].
The solution is washed with 1% H[sub]2[/sub]SO[sub]4[/sub].
Dry it at 130°C using hot air oven for 15 mins.
Dry it at 130°C using hot air oven for 15 mins.
Dry it at 130°C using hot air oven for 15 mins.
Take it out and allow it to cool.
Take it out and allow it to cool.
Take it out and allow it to cool.
Weigh the sintered crucible using an electronic balance.
Weight of crucible+PbSO[sub]4[/sub] =20.2448g.
Weight of crucible+PbSO[sub]4[/sub] =20.2448g.
Lead is precipitated as lead sulphate.
notext
Estimation of Copper
Take the filtrate obtained after complete separation of lead.
Transfer the filtrate into a 250 mL beaker.
notext
Evaporate the filtrate to 50 mL.
Evaporate the filtrate to 50 mL.
Take the beaker from the burner and allow it to cool for some time.
Take the beaker from the burner and allow it to cool for some time.

notext
Take a piece of butter paper.
Weigh accurately 3g Sodium thiosulfate.
Weigh accurately 3g Sodium thiosulfate.
Weigh accurately 3g Sodium thiosulfate.
Add 3g Sodium thiosulfate to the beaker containing the solution.
notext
Heat to boiling and add 10 mL 10% Ammonium thiocyanate solution. A precipitate formed.

Heat to boiling and add 10 mL 10% Ammonium thiocyanate solution. A precipitate formed.
Heat to boiling and add 10 mL 10% Ammonium thiocyanate solution. A precipitate formed.

Boil it again.
Take it from the burner.
Take it from the burner.

notext
Filter through a weighed sintered crucible.
Wash with water.
Wash with water.
Wash with water.
Dry it using a hot air oven.
Dry it using a hot air oven.
Take it out and allow it to cool and then place it in the desiccator for some time.
Take it out and allow it to cool and then place it in the desiccator for some time.
Take it out and allow it to cool and then place it in the desiccator for some time.
notext
Weigh as CuSCN (copper(I)thiocyanate).
Weight of crucible+ CuSCN=20.5237g
